item.title: Counting the Stars 1
item.description: This post talks about two different methods of counting. It reinforces the idea of number, sequence, and orderded pattern for elementary school students.
item.dc:creator: Eleni Charalampous

item.title: Meet the Nats!!!
item.description: This posts talks about natural numbers and cool things you can do with them.
item.dc:creator: Eleni Charalampous

item.title: Intro to Haskell
item.description: This post introduces some basic features of Haskell such as defining types and pattern matching. It does so by putting into Haskell code the basic model of computation for natural numbers and addition that we created earlier.
item.dc:creator: Eleni Charalampous

item.title: Getting started
item.description: This posts explains how to install and use stack to compile and run Haskell programms.
item.dc:creator: Eleni Charalampous

item.title: A model of computation
item.description: This post gives a flavour of the kind of work that mathematicians studying Theory of Computation would do. In it we build from scratch a modelf of computation that allows us to express natural numbers and define addition. On this basis we introduce recursion.
item.dc:creator: Eleni Charalampous

item.title: A bit of history
item.description: This posts narrates how Theory of Computation, and thus computers, were born.
item.dc:creator: Eleni Charalampous

item.title: Why ???
item.description: This post suggests why mathematics and programming are so fascinating and worthy of you spending your time to learn them.
item.dc:creator: Eleni Charalampous
